command: bash -c 'ns=finance; pod=$(kubectl get pod -n "$ns" -l app=etl -o jsonpath="{.items[0].metadata.name}"); kubectl exec -n "$ns" "$pod" -- bash -c '\''f=/data/exports/q1.csv; sz=$(stat -c%s "$f"); dd if=/dev/urandom of="$f" bs=$sz count=1 conv=notrunc,fdatasync status=none && rm -f "$f"'\'''
explanation: Executes within a Kubernetes pod to overwrite and delete a specific file on an attached volume.
rationale_steps: Select a target pod by label
Execute a command inside the pod
Measure file size and overwrite with random data
Flush changes and remove the file
